posts.post_content:
Tezzeret is one of the more interesting planeswalkers; certainly, he has the most narrow focus of any of the currently-printed walkers, and properly supported he's arguably the most useful.  
  
**+1: Untap up to two artifacts.**  
Amazing. This is THE reason to play him. Staying Standard legal, this allows him to manage a pair of [Master Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuter)s. In addition, a standard legal artifact deck is probably using [Obelisk of Esper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obelisk of Esper) or [Fieldmist Borderpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fieldmist Borderpost), so you can play him for essentially 2, just like Garruk. Going outside of Standard, things like [Grim Monolith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grim Monolith) or (if you're playing straight Vintage) [Time Vault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Vault) are simply appalling with this ability.  
  
**-X: Search your library for an artifact with converted mana cost equal or less than X and put it into play.**  
Again, a very powerful ability. It weakens Tezz greatly, but pulling out a [Master Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuter), autocard... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: drakmor (8/20/2009 5:00:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Two words: Amazing synergy. Tezzeret with two [Master Transmuters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuters) is extremely powerful. And when you have master transmuters and an almost [Diabolic Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diabolic Tutor), you win. You don't necessarily even need to use his second ability as long as you have a [Sphinx Summoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx Summoner) at your disposal, and if you don't, tutor him into your hand. The only problem with him is his ultimate ability. It's nowhere near as powerful as most of the other planeswalkers' ultimates. Sure it beats out [Ajani Goldmane](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani Goldmane)'s ultimate, but all of the other ultimates are far better. That being said, being able to untap two master transmuters is pretty ultimate in itself.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Thought i might mention the Tezzeret+[Time Sieve](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Sieve)+[Open the Vaults](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Open the Vaults) combo, no need for a crusty old [Time Vault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Vault). his second ability can pull you a Time Sieve the turn you summon him, from there you can take turns till you have an open the vaults handy, have added enough loyalty to Tezzeret with his first ability untapping [Fieldmist Borderpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fieldmist Borderpost) and [Obelisk of Esper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obelisk of Esper), and have sacced enough artifacts to allow Tezzerets third ability to win you the game. This is a bit vulnerable to quick creature swarm decks, but once u get your combo rolling your opponent wont get another turn to respond.   
  
@yasin757: Tezzerets third ability is not bad. Gaining your entire deck worth of artifacts you have put into your graveyard as 5/5 creatures is not bad. even if they don't have flying, only 4 need to hit your opponent. If you are able to get a [Gl\*\*\*dust Hulk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gl***dust Hulk) onto the field prior to us... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
I agree, great card.
  
First ability: untap artifact lands or sigils or whatever for at least 2 mana. (like garruk)
  
Or attack and untap 2 blockers, or improve any artifact tap-combo's...
  
His third ability can be used the second turn already, just play tezzeret at the right moment and the game is yours!
  
And the second ability makes this a bomb agains any deck, for 5 mana you get any artifact you can imagine with CMC 4 or less, great for combo's or you can even fetch ornithopter or an artifact-land for 0 loyalty...
  
   
Except for garruk I think this is the greatest walker of the 9.
  
(Elspeth is to slow and Sarkhan to aggro for vintage or legacy)

posts.post_content:
When I see Tezzeret, there's a voice in my head saying: [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice), only if you have mana generation, few of [Silver Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silver Myr) or other stuff like [Arc Dagsson](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc Dagsson) or [Master Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuter), of course.  
If lacks of mana, or time, well, why don't try out [March of the Machines](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=March of the Machines) instead?  
Tezzeret gives you a lot of possibilities, a really good option for an artifact deck.  
You can also try out [Darksteel Citadel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Citadel),... just 4 artifacts on game are enough to make some noise...

posts.post_content:
The thing that needs to be seen here, is that while people are saying Tezzeret is a good card, but only for Artifacts, or that Tezzeret is bad, except for Artifacts, the whole point of Tezzeret is to make your artifact decks BROKEN. Sure, he does nothing on his own, but then, why should he? He's a supporter, as all Planeswalkers really should be. He doesn't do well on his own, or in most decks, granted, but he's not meant for most decks. He is MEANT FOR ARTIFACTS.  
  
I have seen him run for turn three with Time Vault. Numerous times. Consistently. Sure, he can't blaze a creature, mill for twenty cards, destroy lands, or summon your opponents' dead creatures, but he does help your arti-lands blast through multiple Savannah Lions and Serra Avengers. Indeed, he's a utility card...and a very good one at that.  
  
Ah, yes, Arkive, but it's not reusable, unless you're using huge-cost cards that could easily be avoided with 2, maybe 3 mana. And even then, it's more reliable to use the Key, since T... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: U-caster (1/9/2010 5:52:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ha!  
Turn One: Artifact-Land  
Turn Two: Artifact-Land, signet  
Turn Three: Artifact Land, [Mishra, artificer prodigy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mishra, artificer prodigy)  
Turn Four: Artifact Land, A few more signets(no net mana loss for the turn due to mishra doubling them),[Gilded Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilded Lotus)(+1 from mishra), tezzeret(untapping the lotuses), [sphinx summoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sphinx summoner)(+1 from mishra)(summoning another summoner and anything from [darksteel colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=darksteel colossus) to [platinum angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=platinum angel)  
  
That is the new casual deck I have been playing. Since Tezz goes off next turn, I usually swing for about 69-79 on turn five, which will often kill at least three other players at the table. If you leave a few lands and a lotus untapped and attack for about 49 or so instead, you can play a platinum angel after the attack, which is often a wrecking since people use most of their removal on the lethal attackers.  
Very fun deck.

That is the new casual deck I have been playing. Since Tezz goes off next turn, I usually swing for about 69-79 on turn five, which will often kill at least three other players at the table.
